docs.text: My Website This is my website . This document is created using Markdown . My Website Creation My website was created using the mkdocs application. The mkdocs.yml file used for configuration is as follows: site_name: My Website site_dir: site/docs # The folder site is a git repository on the laptop. # The folder docs is the website and contains index.html. # Github will therefore have a docs folder # Github Pages Source is set to master branch docs/ folder nav: - Home: index.md The folder site is a git repository (venv7) ian@X200:~/my-website/site$ ls -Al total 8 drwxrwxr-x 7 ian ian 4096 Aug 28 11:40 docs drwxrwxr-x 8 ian ian 4096 Aug 28 11:43 .git By creating my website in the folder docs, this then matches with a Github default folder name for project websites. I created my-website repository on irsbugs account of github In creating i I didn't add any README.md so there were no files in the account. I then went to my laptop where a mkdocs site folder has had git applied. I issued the command: $ git remote add origin https://github.com/irsbugs/my-website.git $ git push -u origin master After this went to my github account and the files and folders from my laptops site folder were in https://github.com/irsbugs/my-website/... In github Settins I set the Github Pages source to be master branch. I was then able to use my laptops browser to go to https://irsbugs.github.io/my-website/index.html and the web-site was available. For some reason https://irsbugs.github.io/my-website/ would give a 404 error but it was OK with the index.html appended to it. Updating Example of updating after editing index.md Update mkdocs and check in local browser (venv7) ian@X200:~/my-website$ mkdocs build --clean && mkdocs serve INFO - Cleaning site directory INFO - Building documentation to directory: /home/ian/my-website/site INFO - Building documentation... INFO - Cleaning site directory [I 190828 07:25:24 server:296] Serving on http://127.0.0.1:8000 [I 190828 07:25:24 handlers:62] Start watching changes Now commit the updates in site folder (venv7) ian@X200:~/my-website$ cd site (venv7) ian@X200:~/my-website/site$ git commit -a -m "updates to index.md" 4 files changed, 14 insertions(+), 4 deletions(-) (venv7) ian@X200:~/my-website/site$ Note: If you leave out the -m "message" then a session of nano will open to prompt you to add the message. Now push the changes on the laptop to github (venv7) ian@X200:~/my-website/site$ git push -u origin master Username for 'https://github.com': irsbugs Password for 'https://irsbugs@github.com': Counting objects: 7, done. Delta compression using up to 2 threads. Compressing objects: 100% (7/7), done. Writing objects: 100% (7/7), 1.65 KiB | 1.65 MiB/s, done. Total 7 (delta 4), reused 0 (delta 0) remote: Resolving deltas: 100% (4/4), completed with 4 local objects. To https://github.com/irsbugs/my-website.git 4784b0f..dcf52a7 master -> master Branch 'master' set up to track remote branch 'master' from 'origin'. Repeat of Example: (venv7) ian@X200:~/my-website/site$ cd .. (venv7) ian@X200:~/my-website$ mkdocs build --clean INFO - Cleaning site directory INFO - Building documentation to directory: /home/ian/my-website/site (venv7) ian@X200:~/my-website$ cd site (venv7) ian@X200:~/my-website/site$ git commit -a -m "updates" [master dd16e66] updates 3 files changed, 5 insertions(+), 7 deletions(-) rewrite search/search_index.json (67%) (venv7) ian@X200:~/my-website/site$ git push -u origin master Username for 'https://github.com': irsbugs Password for 'https://irsbugs@github.com': Counting objects: 6, done. Delta compression using up to 2 threads. Compressing objects: 100% (6/6), done. Writing objects: 100% (6/6), 727 bytes | 727.00 KiB/s, done. Total 6 (delta 5), reused 0 (delta 0) remote: Resolving deltas: 100% (5/5), completed with 5 local objects. To https://github.com/irsbugs/my-website.git 1d35d05..dd16e66 master -> master Branch 'master' set up to track remote branch 'master' from 'origin'. (venv7) ian@X200:~/my-website/site$
